snippet: In a blow to marijuana advocates, the Colorado Supreme Court found that a satellite-television provider acted within the law when it fired an employee after he failed a drug test.
abstract: Colorado Supreme Court rules that satellite-television provider Dish Network acted within law when it fired Brandon Coats in 2010 for failing random drug test; Coats has medical marijuana card, but marijuana, although medically legal in Colorado, is still outlawed as Schedule I controlled substance by federal government.
lead_paragraph: In a blow to marijuana advocates, the Colorado Supreme Court found that a satellite-television provider acted within the law when it fired an employee after he failed a drug test.

headline.main: Workers Can Be Fired for Marijuana Use, Colorado Court Rules
headline.print_headline: Workers Can Be Fired for Legal Marijuana, Colorado Court Rules
